measured_by: Two-item Ability sub-scale taken from Höddinghaus et al., 2020
justification: "Ability was measured with two items taken from Höddinghaus et al. (2020). A sample item was 'I believe the colleague/the automated system has the competency to consider all important information for the decision.'"

measured_by: Two-item Flexibility sub-scale taken from Höddinghaus et al., 2020
justification: "Flexibility was measured with two items taken from Höddinghaus et al. (2020). A sample item was 'I believe the colleague/the automated system is able to react flexibly to given contexts.'"

measured_by: Two-item Integrity sub-scale adapted from Thielsch et al., 2018
justification: "Integrity was measured with two items taken from ... Thielsch et al. (2018)."

measured_by: Two-item Benevolence sub-scale adapted from Wang & Benbasat 2005
justification: "Benevolence was measured with two items taken from Wang and Benbasat (2005). A sample item was 'The colleague/the automated system would consider my interests.'"

measured_by: Composite mean of Ability, Flexibility, Integrity, and Benevolence items
justification: "Trustworthiness was calculated as the mean of the items for Ability, Flexibility, Integrity and Benevolence."

measured_by: Two-item Trust scale (source as noted in Measures section)
justification: "Trust was measured with two items taken from ..." (Measures section describing the trust items).

measured_by: Single behavioural item: ‘I accept this preselection’ (Yes/No)
justification: "Reliance was measured with the item 'I accept this preselection' with the response options 'Yes' or 'No'."

measured_by: Single fairness perception item: ‘I perceived the preselection to be fair’
justification: "participants responded to the item 'I perceived the preselection to be fair' which was meant to assess whether participants perceived a predominantly male preselection to be unfair."

measured_by: Three goal-adherence items (customer satisfaction, innovation, diversity) – diversity item used as manipulation check
justification: "participants responded to the item 'In your opinion, did the preselection adhere to the company's goals?' ... This reminded participants of the company's goals and allowed us to assess if participants realized that the biased preselection violated the organization's diversity goal."
